channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report I-2023060106
item.description:
Report I-2023060106

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-06
  • City: Council Bluffs
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HOLLAND INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: One pail was punctured by the forklift blade. The release was properly managed. The damaged pail was placed into a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2023060421
item.description:
Report E-2023060421

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDM experienced a UN3082 "Enlist Duo" release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-cups of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the top of the poly tote due to a defective cap. Contractors transferred the product from the damaged tote into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with absorbent pads into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023060418
item.description:
Report E-2023060418

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-01
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 1, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon jug of potassium hydroxide (UN3266) was damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) ounce of product to a cardboard box. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel utilized absorbent pads to collect all free standing product, then wiped down the undamaged cargo for continued shipping. The crew then overpacked the damaged jug, impacted box, and all other UN3266 impacted material in one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal.

item.description:
Report X-2023060718

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-07
  • City: DAVENPORT
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UNLOADER WAS EMPTYING OUT THE IRREG CHUTE AND NOTICED A PUDDLE OF LIQUID COMING FROM HAZMAT PACKAGE, EMPLOYEE LEFT AREA AND NOTIFIED A SUPERVISOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A HAZMAT RESPONDER. RESPONDER RESPONDED TO LEAKING PACKAGE, CLEANED, AND TRANSPORTED TO DMP FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2023060144
item.description:
Report E-2023060144

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-01
  • City: Des Moines
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver noticed residue on outside of drum when stopped to check his load in transit. He noticed some liquid residue on outside of container and called it in. The Cleanharbors response team was sent out to conduct the clean up. They used absorbent wags to wipe the residue off the drum while wearing the proper PPE and disposed of them in a properly labeled container for disposal. The drum ring was tightened to prevent anymore spillage.

item.title: Report E-2023060274
item.description:
Report E-2023060274

  • City: DES MOINES

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of motor treatment (un1193) had been crushed by other freight and that one of the inner metal 16 ounce cans had released 16 ounce of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UNLOAD FOUND HAZMAT WITH SLIGHTLY WET BOTTOM CORNER IN TRAILER. DescribePack: BOTTOM EDGE OF PACKAGE WAS DROPPED AND CAN INSIDE DENTED, CAUSING MINOR LEAK IN BOTTOM EDGE OF CAN. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT CAN FROM INSIDE BOX WAS PLACES IN HAZMAT BAG / TOTE UPSIDE DOWN.

item.title: Report X-2023050779
item.description:
Report X-2023050779

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-12
  • City: GRIMES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered around 7am in our unload. The box was put in a plastic lined hazmat tote and brought to our QA station. DescribePack: Caps were both loose. Package was repacked in KCMO and put in a plastic bag. This seems very unsafe. The outside of the box was drenched upon arrival to our station DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: as mentioned above, the package was immediately put in a hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2023050279
item.description:
Report X-2023050279

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-03
  • City: GRIMES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was informed that there was a leaking hazmat at our door 10. it appears there was too much weight in packages loaded ON TOP of the hazmat. (see pictures) DescribePack: The package was crushed under this weight and the gallon jugs were strained, causing failure of the caps on the jugs. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: immediately put an absorbent on the leaked corrosive material. It was absorbed and all of the boxes that were damaged by the leaking were transferred to QA.
